lines.content: * The Duke class represents a chatbot that manages tasks.
* It is the main class that contains the methods to run the chatbot.
* Creates a Duke instance that represents the chatbot.
* @param filePath The path to the file where tasks are saved and loaded from.
this.ui.showError("Unable to load saved task. Starting with a new empty task list");
* Runs the Duke chatbot. It reads and executes commands from the user until the user exits.
* Represents a command to add a task to the taskList.
* This class is a child of the abstract Command class and
* contains method to execute the add task command,
* including methods to check whether it is an exit command.
/** Task to be added to the task list */
* Creates a new add command with the specified task to be added.
* @param task The task to be added to the taskList.
* This method adds the task to the taskList,
* and invokes the UI to display the add task message.
* @param tasks The list of task on which the command will operate on.
* @param ui The UI which is used during the command execution to show add text.
* @param storage The storage where tasks are stored and retrieved from, currently
*                not utilized in this method but can be extended to use in the future.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that this command is not an exit command.
* @return false, as this command does not cause the program to exit.
* Represents a command to print out the goodbye message
* and also saves the current list of tasks into the storage file.
* This class is a child of the abstract Command class
* and contains method to execute the bye command,
* including methods to check whether it is an exit command.
* This method  use the UI to display the goodbye message
* and then saves the current list of tasks into the storage and thereafter exits the program.
* @param tasks The current list of task to be saved.
* @param ui The UI which is used during the command execution to show goodbye text.
* @param storage The storage where list of tasks are stored.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that this command is an exit command.
* @return true, as this command causes the program to exit.
* Represents an abstract command that can be executed.
* This class is used to represent the command to be executed
* based on type of input the user gives.
* Executes the specific command implemented in subclasses.
* The command execution can interact with the specified taskList, user interface, and storage.
* @param tasks The list of tasks on which the command will operate on.
* @param ui The UI which is used during the command execution.
* @param storage The storage where tasks are stored and retrieved from.
public abstract void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage);
* Checks if the command ends the program.
* @return true if the command ends the program, false otherwise.
* Represents a command to delete a task from the task list.
* This class is a child of the abstract Command class
* and contains method to execute the delete command,
* including methods to check whether it is an exit command.
/** Number of the task in the task list */
* Creates a new delete command with the specified number for the task to be deleted.
* @param taskNumber The number of the task to be deleted from the task list.
* This method retrieves the task to be deleted using the number,
* deletes the task from the task list,
* and invokes UI to display the delete task message.
* @param tasks The list of tasks on which the command will operate on.
* @param ui The UI which is used during the command execution to show delete text.
* @param storage The storage where tasks are stored and retrieved from, currently
*                not utilized in this method but can be extended to use in the future.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that this command is not an exit command.
* @return false, as this command does not cause the program to exit.
* Represents a command to display an error message in the UI.
* This class extends the Command class and contains method to execute the error command
* and to check whether it is an exit command.
/** Error message to be displayed in the UI */
* Creates a new ErrorCommand with the specified error message to be displayed in the UI.
* @param errorMessage The error message to be displayed in the UI.
* Executes the error command by displaying the error message in the UI.
* @param tasks The list of tasks, which is not utilized in this method
*              but is here to override the abstract method in the parent class.
* @param ui The UI where the error message will be displayed.
* @param storage The storage of tasks, which is not utilized in this method
*                but is here to override the abstract method in the parent class.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that this command is not an exit command.
* @return false, as this command does not cause the program to exit.
* Represents a command that searches the task list for a specific keyword.
* This command when executed, will search through all the tasks present in the task list and
* displays the ones that contain the specified keyword.
/** The keyword to search for in tasks. */
* Creates a FindCommand with the keyword that the user is searching for.
* @param keyWord The keyword to search for in the task list.
* This method goes through the tasks in the taskList, and searches for the tasks that contain the keyword,
* then invokes the UI to these tasks.
* @param tasks The list of task on which the command will operate on.
* @param ui The UI which is used during the command execution to show find text.
* @param storage The storage where tasks are stored and retrieved from, currently not utilized in this method but can be extended to use in the future.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that this command is not an exit command.
* @return false, as this command does not cause the program to exit.
* Represents a command to list all the current tasks.
* This class extends the Command class and contains method to execute the list command
* and to check whether it is an exit command.
* Executes the list command which triggers the UI
* to display all tasks currently in the task list.
* @param tasks The list of tasks to be displayed in the UI.
* @param ui The UI where the task list will be displayed.
* @param storage The storage of tasks, which is not utilized in this method but
*                is here to override the abstract method in the parent class.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that this command is not an exit command.
* @return false, as this command does not cause the program to exit.
* Represents a command to mark a task as done.
* This class extends the Command class and contains method to execute the mark command
* and to check whether it is an exit command.
/** Number of the task to be mark as done from the task list */
* Creates a new mark command with the specified number for the task to be marked done.
* @param taskNumber The number of the task to be marked as done from the task list.
* This method retrieves the task to be marked using the number,
* marks the task from the task list,
* and invokes UI to display the mark task message.
* @param tasks The list of tasks on which the command will operate on.
* @param ui The UI which is used during the command execution to show the mark task text.
* @param storage The storage where tasks are stored and retrieved from, currently
*                not utilized in this method but can be extended to use in the future.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {
* Specifies that this command is not an exit command.
* @return false, as this command does not cause the program to exit.
* Represents a command to mark a task as undone.
* This class extends the Command class and contains method to execute the unmark command
* and to check whether it is an exit command.
/** Number of the task to be mark as undone from the task list */
* Creates a new unmark command with the specified number for the task to be marked undone.
* @param taskNumber The number of the task to be marked as undone from the task list.
* This method retrieves the task to be marked undone using the number,
* marks the task from the task list as undone,
* and invokes UI to display the unmark task message.
* @param tasks The list of tasks on which the command will operate on.
* @param ui The UI which is used during the command execution to show the unmark task text.
* @param storage The storage where tasks are stored and retrieved from, currently
*                not utilized in this method but can be extended to use in the future.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* @return false, as this command does not cause the program to exit.
* Represents a command to print out the welcome message
* and also load list of tasks from the storage file, or create a storage file if there isn't one.
* This class is a child of the abstract Command class
* and contains method to execute the welcome command,
* including methods to check whether it is an exit command.
* It calls the showWelcome method of the Ui  to print out the welcome message.
* @param tasks The task list that will store the list of tasks
*              being loaded from the storage file.
* @param ui The UI that is used during command execution to show the welcome message.
* @param storage The storage where the list of tasks are loaded from.
public void execute(TaskList tasks, Ui ui, Storage storage) {

* Responsible for reading from and writing to the

* The enumeration of all possible task types: TODO, DEADLINE, and EVENT.
* Represents an abstract Task class with a type, name, and completion status.
* The Task class serves as a template for different types
* of tasks such as TODO, DEADLINE, and EVENT.
* Constructs a Task object with a specified name and type of task.
* @param taskName The name or description of the task.
* @param taskType The type of the task, as defined in the TaskType enum.
* Returns a string representation of the task, indicating its completion status and name.
* @return A string representing the task, where a done task is represented with "[X]"
*         and an undone task with "[ ]", followed by the task name.
* Marks the task as done by setting the isDone attribute to true.
* Marks the task as undone by setting the isDone attribute to false.
* Represents a "ToDo" task, extending the abstract Task class.
* A "ToDo" task is a simple task with only a description and no time or date associated with it.
* Constructs a ToDo instance with a specified task name,
* automatically setting its task type to TODO.
* @param taskName The name or description of the ToDo task.
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task,
* which includes its task type represented as "[T]"
* followed by its status (done or not done) and its name.
* @return A string representing the ToDo task.
* Parses a string representation of a ToDo task back into a ToDo object.
* It reads the task's description and completion status from the given string
* and creates a corresponding ToDo object.
* @param line The string representation of the ToDo task, typically read from a data file.
* @return A ToDo object that corresponds to the data in the given line of String.
